column4: Does anybody here using a bootsplash screen they made themselves?
ive not made any but there should be a few around the gaff
I have the page book marked was trying to find someone who has actaully made a working splash using that
i dunno, i see splashes as pointless
Most stuff is pointless like desktop effects but makes it look "cool"
i use fluxbox, desktop effects != cool
see the effects are pointless but enjoyable
i dont find them enjoyable, i want my system to do what i wat rather than do some song and dance then do it
ya its a personal prefrence, for you the functionality is cooler
indeed, some people love prettys and thats fine
its not so much for the pretty factor its just when it boots it says ubuntu but i like art and would like to have my own art in that place
I've even got a few ideas for a custom loading bar, granted its unnessary but to me it be more astecicly pleasing , part of what i like about ubuntu is its large ability for customization
all linuxes have that level of customisation
yes thats one of the things I really like about it
gentoo goes further that you can customise what apps you install and compile them with custom options
I've got everything worked out just how I like it so far , basicly the last thing that I'd like to customize on it is the boot splash , after which its as close to perfect as I'd lke it to be
The bootsplash be like the iceing on the cake for me
id rather it load the app rather than a splash then th eapp, makes it load slower

Its not for before the apps , you know when the pc first boots and we see scrolling text that shows the system starting up  well the splash screen is just above that scrolling text and I wanted to replace that default art with some of my own
either way I have to wait for it to load but i figured some of my art be cooler than the orange ubuntu logo
and by enabling text I could still monitor the scrolling text to see that everything booted ok
that is an advantage, i dont use my system for much and can troubleshoot when i get in. i dont reboot much so im ok :)
I dont reboot much either but I been considering putting ubuntu on my laptop and think it would spiffy to have that last thing worked out before I setup the laptop
